page.title: 18FARMING CHANGES - MONTFORD
page.content:
Local farmers in the area remark on how much the industry has changed in recent years. The greater use of fertilisers, pesticides and weedkillers, plus substantial mechanisation, and a wide range of new land management techniques, have considerably increased crop and animal yields. Some argue, though, that the increased production levels have resulted in such surpluses for certain crops that their profit margins have been drastically cut.
Government, and especially EEC, interference in the industry is criticised by many. In particular, the difficulties and injustices caused by the newly introduced milk quota system have caused much resentment. Many are reducing their herds as a result.
